events.event_description: Plaquemines LNG, the eighth U.S. liquefied natural gas export terminal, shipped its first cargo after achieving first LNG production in mid-December.
events.citation: On December 26, 2024, Plaquemines LNG—the eighth liquefied natural gas (LNG) export terminal in the United States—shipped its first cargo after achieving first LNG production in mid-December.

events.event_description: Corpus Christi Stage 3, an expansion of the existing Corpus Christi LNG export terminal, began LNG production.
events.citation: Corpus Christi Stage 3 (an expansion of the existing Corpus Christi LNG export terminal) also began LNG production in December 2024.

events.event_description: Venture Global LNG plans to commission and start exporting LNG from Plaquemines Phase 2.
events.citation: Venture Global LNG plans to commission and start exporting LNG from Plaquemines Phase 2 in September 2025.

events.event_description: U.S. LNG export capacity expected to expand to 21.2 Bcf/d peak capacity with completion of Golden Pass LNG, Rio Grande LNG, and Port Arthur LNG projects.
events.citation: We estimate nominal LNG export capacity will expand to 21.2 Bcf/d (25.2 Bcf/d peak) by 2028 once three other U.S. LNG export projects currently under construction—Golden Pass LNG, Rio Grande LNG, and Port Arthur LNG—are completed.
